channel.title: New system
channel.description: So about time our house had a new computer, Im fine with mine for now but derp needs one, so build him a computer! Budget is £1500 but this has to include cost of monitors, case, speakers etc. So its going to run Windows 7 and linux (don't know what one yet.) it needs duel monitors, a decent sound system. I'm a britfag so GOGOGO

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:

im guessing you didnt read his edit…

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:19, topic:312464”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=408862.msg3022755#msg3022755 date=1257694102]
Computer Case Cooler Master Elite 330

CPU Intel Core 2 Extreme QX9650 (4 x 3.0 GHZ) 1333FSB - 12 MB

Motherboard ASUS STRIKER II NSE 1600FSB (NVIDIA 790i) DDR3

Memory Corsair XMS2 4GB PC2-8500 1066 MHZ (2 x 2 GB) - Lifetime Warranty (DDR2)

Graphics Card NVIDIA GeForce 9800GT - 512 MB - 2xDVI/VGA (Palit)

Power Supply OCZ 600W Stealth XStream - Low Noise

Hard Drive 1 1 TB (1000 GB) SATA-II HDD UDMA 300 7200 32MB (Includes One-Click Cleanup 2009 Software)

Hard Drive 2 250 GB SATA-II HDD UDMA 300 7200 8MB

Optical Drive 1 LG (GGC-H20L) Blu-Ray HD-DVD Reader & Dual Layer DVD +/- RW Writer - Black (SATA)

Optical Drive 2 ASUS (DRW-2014L1T) DVD /- RW 22x - Silver - Lightscribe (SATA)

Sound Card Asus Xonar D2 Ultra Fidelity 7.1 (PCI)

Networking Motherboard Integrated Ethernet Lan (Broadband Ready)

USB Ports 10 X USB 2.0 Ports

CPU Heatsink ThermalTake Blue ORB II - Low Noise

Backup Solution Standard Operating System Backup

Monitor 2 x 19" Widescreen TFT Silver/Black (Dual Screen Setup) - 5MS

Speakers Logitech 2.1 S-220 Black Speakers

Write on your budget;

£1,482

Computer Planet

Computer Planet: Build You Own PC Today with Free Delivery

Computer Planet builds the best custom PCs on the planet! Choose a Gaming PC, CAD Workstation or other configuration or design your own PC from scratch


[/quote]
you dont need 2 monitors, you dont need 2 optical drives
EDIT:my bad OP requested 2 monitors cuz hes homo
here’s my list with 1 monitor (deal with it niggerdog)
so thats £16 over with shipping, but is sexy, has 2 GFX cards so ultimate power, has an SSD drive for your OS and a few choice games to boot ultra fast and a 1.5TB drive for the rest of the shit
and here is the image cuz its easier to see
[/quote]

Im guessing you didn’t read the question… it needs duel monitors

Read full topic

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

i did think about that when spec’ing that rig but id prefer to have an nvidia card for some of its advantages like PhysX and their 3D gaming experience but OP is free to change it if he wishes

Read full topic

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Honestly, while the GT275 is a good card. I think its best to go with a more up to date card like the 5870, that is a single card that near enough matches the performance of two 275’s and won’t ever have any scaling or microstutter issues due to SLI.

Read full topic

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The soundcards on Gigabyte motherboards are absolutely brilliant.

I threw that together within a few minutes just as a quick outline as i didn’t know specifics of what it was to be used for. The speakers and built in soundcard on that setup is more than decent.

Read full topic

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

He said decent sound system, an onboard card has shit sound. You can get a separate sound card for less than $50 and you’ll hear the difference instantly.

Ps those speakers really do suck, i have an old set lying around in fact.

My suggestion would be a pair of Harman Kardon Soundsticks II and a < $50 sound card by asus, this would give you a nice budget sound system

Read full topic

item.title: New system
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:4, topic:312464”]What will he be using it for? Gaming? Audio/Video editing?

EDIT: This is a cheaper system, could easily be used for gaming, but if you wanted to max out the budget it could be better, just would have to change the case, the video card and maybe the RAM.

[/quote]
swap that mobo out for the EX58-UD5, and spel 'sif you need a sound card onboard sound will be fine

Read full topic
